sections.title: Context & Current State
sections.goal: Establish the current operational baseline of Aegis IAM and surface any known security posture facts.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the current Aegis IAM architecture and its enforcement points?
What are the most recent audit findings from AUD-24-Q2 that impact our RBAC or JIT access?
How do you ensure our implementation aligns with POL-SEC-001 'Least Privilege & JIT Access'?

sections.title: Threat Modeling & Vulnerability Management
sections.goal: Explore how threats are identified, modeled, and mitigated in the IAM system.
sample_questions: Describe your process for threat modeling changes proposed in RFC-903.
How are vulnerabilities in IAM components tracked and prioritized?
What is your approach to limiting BLAST_RADIUS if a privileged token is compromised?

sections.title: Cross-System Dependencies
sections.goal: Identify and assess security implications of Aegis IAM's integration with other projects.
sample_questions: Which other Novereon projects consume Aegis IAM for auth and how do you handle their varying trust boundaries?
Can you give an example of an incident where IAM changes affected another system such as Orion Edge Gateway?
How do you validate that service-to-service mTLS policies from Poseidon Networking are enforced for IAM?

sections.title: Incident Response & Evidence
sections.goal: Understand incident handling procedures and evidence-based decision making.
sample_questions: Walk me through RB-IAM-075 and how it was applied in the last emergency access revocation.
What evidence do you collect during an IAM breach investigation to satisfy compliance audits?
How do you ensure incident learnings are integrated into runbooks and RFC updates?

sections.title: Trade-offs & Risk Decisions
sections.goal: Discuss recent or upcoming decisions involving security trade-offs, backed by evidence.
sample_questions: Describe a case where you had to balance operational continuity with strict enforcement of least privilege.
What were the alternative designs considered for JIT access provisioning and why were they rejected?
How do you quantify and communicate residual risk to stakeholders?
